User Story: As a player, I want to read clearly formatted narrative text so I can immerse myself in the story.
Acceptance Criteria:
The NarrativeDisplay component renders text with clear paragraph breaks
The display automatically scrolls to show the latest content
Text is formatted with appropriate spacing and margins
Font size is readable on all screen sizes
Text updates smoothly when new content is added

User Story: As a player, I want to distinguish between narrative text and character dialogue so I can follow conversations.
Acceptance Criteria:
Dialogue is visually distinct from narrative description
Different speakers are clearly identified when possible
Formatting is consistent throughout the narrative
Dialogue stands out visually on the page
The distinction works on all screen sizes

User Story: As a player, I want proper text formatting with paragraphs and emphasis so it's easy to read.
Acceptance Criteria:
Text formatting (emphasis, etc.) is rendered correctly
Paragraphs have appropriate spacing between them
Important text elements receive proper emphasis
Formatting is consistent throughout the experience
Content is legible on all supported screen sizes

User Story: As a player, I want to see clearly presented choices so I can make informed decisions.
Acceptance Criteria:
The ChoiceSelector displays 3-4 choices as buttons or cards
Selecting a choice triggers the corresponding narrative action
A text input field allows custom responses when appropriate
Choices are clearly distinguished from each other
Choice text is complete and readable

User Story: As a player, I want visual feedback when selecting a choice so I know my selection was registered.
Acceptance Criteria:
Choices have hover/focus states for visual feedback
The selected choice is highlighted when chosen
There is a visual transition when a choice is selected
The interface provides clear confirmation of selection
Visual feedback is consistent across all choice components

User Story: As a player, I want choices to be disabled while the AI generates content so I don't make inadvertent selections.
Acceptance Criteria:
Choices are visibly disabled during AI processing
The disabled state is clearly indicated visually
Attempting to click disabled choices has no effect
Choices are automatically re-enabled when AI completes
Transition between enabled and disabled states is smooth

User Story: As a player, I want to see my character's basic information during gameplay so I can remember who I'm playing.
Acceptance Criteria:
The CharacterSummary displays the character's name and description
Basic character status information is visible
Character information is accessible throughout gameplay
The display is unobtrusive but easily referenced
Information updates if character status changes

User Story: As a player, I want to collapse or expand the character panel so I can focus on the narrative when desired.
Acceptance Criteria:
The character panel can be collapsed and expanded
The collapsed state maximizes narrative display space
The state persists during the session
The panel automatically collapses on smaller screens
Collapse/expand control is intuitive and accessible

User Story: As a player, I want to know when my game is being saved so I don't lose progress.
Acceptance Criteria:
The UI displays the last saved timestamp
Auto-save events show a visual indicator
Save status is clearly visible in the interface
Failed saves trigger a notification
The indicator doesn't disrupt the gameplay experience

User Story: As a player, I want to manually save my game when reaching important points.
Acceptance Criteria:
A manual save button is readily accessible
Successful saves provide visual confirmation
The save button is disabled during processing
Save failures show appropriate error messages
The manual save doesn't interrupt gameplay flow

User Story: As a player, I want to exit the game safely with my progress saved.
Acceptance Criteria:
An exit button is clearly accessible
Exiting prompts for confirmation before leaving
The game state is saved before exiting
The exit process is responsive and quick
Exiting returns to an appropriate menu or screen

User Story: As a player, I want to recover from unexpected crashes without losing significant progress.
Acceptance Criteria:
The system automatically recovers session state after crashes
Recovery restores the most recent saved state
Progress loss is minimized to a few minutes at most
Recovery options are presented when needed
The recovery process is transparent to the user

User Story: As a player, I want to be able to resume my game session exactly where I left off.
Acceptance Criteria:
The session resumes from the last saved state
Narrative context and choices are restored correctly
Character information is preserved accurately
Session history is accessible and complete
Resume feels seamless with minimal disruption

User Story: As a player, I want to see when the AI is generating content so I know to wait.
Acceptance Criteria:
A loading indicator displays during AI content generation
The indicator is visually prominent without being distracting
Loading state prevents premature user interactions
The indicator gives sense of progress, not just waiting
Loading animations are smooth and performant

User Story: As a player, I want friendly error messages when issues occur so I understand what happened.
Acceptance Criteria:
Error messages use non-technical, friendly language
Errors appear in a consistent, recognizable format
Messages suggest possible actions when appropriate
Critical errors are visually distinct from warnings
Error display doesn't disrupt the interface layout

User Story: As a player, I want the option to retry after errors so I can continue playing.
Acceptance Criteria:
Retry options are presented for recoverable errors
Retry button is clearly visible and accessible
Multiple retry attempts are supported when appropriate
System provides feedback during retry attempts
Persistent failures offer alternative solutions

User Story: As a player, I want clear visual feedback for all interactions so I know my actions are registered.
Acceptance Criteria:
All interactive elements provide visual feedback on interaction
Button presses have clear visual states (pressed, active, etc.)
Form inputs show focus and active states
System actions provide completion indicators
Feedback is consistent across all interface elements

User Story: As a player, I want to know my current location in the narrative so I have context for my actions.
Acceptance Criteria:
The location indicator shows current narrative location
Location updates are reflected promptly
Location indicator is consistently placed in the interface
Location context helps orient the player
Location display is subtle but accessible

User Story: As a player with a keyboard, I want full keyboard navigation so I can play without a mouse.
Acceptance Criteria:
All interactive elements are navigable using keyboard
Focus states are clearly visible for keyboard navigation
Tab order follows a logical flow through the interface
Keyboard shortcuts are available for common actions
Modal dialogs trap focus appropriately

User Story: As a player using a screen reader, I want proper ARIA attributes so I can understand the interface.
Acceptance Criteria:
Core elements use appropriate ARIA roles and attributes
Dynamic content updates are announced to screen readers
Interactive elements have proper accessible names
Interface structure uses semantic HTML elements
Screen reader testing confirms usability

User Story: As a player with visual impairments, I want sufficient color contrast so I can see all interface elements.
Acceptance Criteria:
Color contrast meets WCAG AA standards
Text is legible against all backgrounds
Interactive elements are visually distinct
Critical information doesn't rely solely on color
Interface remains usable in high-contrast mode

Acceptance Criteria:
Touch targets are appropriately sized (minimum 44Ã—44px)
Controls are positioned for comfortable reach
Touch interactions have appropriate feedback
Gestures are used when appropriate and intuitive
The interface adapts to different mobile device sizes
